settings.description: Deploys Microsoft's recommended Windows security baseline profile containing preconfigured security settings for Windows 10/11 devices. This baseline serves as the foundational security configuration for all managed endpoints.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Security baselines
2. Select 'Security Baseline for Windows 10 and later'
3. Click 'Create policy' and name it (e.g., 'Windows Security Baseline - Standard')
4. Review default settings (BitLocker, authentication, Defender configurations)
5. Assign to device groups representing all managed Windows endpoints
6. Set deployment to 'Enabled' and save policy
7. Monitor deployment status via Endpoint security > Security baselines > Monitor

settings.description: Enforces that devices meet baseline security configuration requirements including minimum OS version, encryption, and security settings. Devices must maintain compliance with defined baseline to access resources.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune admin center > Devices > Compliance > Policies
2. Click 'Create policy' > Select 'Windows 10 and later'
3. Name the policy (e.g., 'Windows Baseline Compliance')
4. Configure compliance settings:
   - Device Health: Require BitLocker, Secure Boot
   - Device Properties: Minimum OS version (e.g., Windows 10 1909)
   - System Security: Require device encryption, firewall enabled
5. Set 'Mark devices with no compliance policy as' to 'Not compliant'
6. Configure Actions for noncompliance (e.g., mark noncompliant immediately)
7. Assign to device groups and save policy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Compliance policies define and enforce the minimum baseline configuration requirements that all devices must meet, providing continuous validation of baseline adherence

settings.description: Enforces that only devices meeting baseline configuration requirements (marked as compliant in Intune) can access organizational resources. This ensures baseline adherence before resource access.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Entra admin center > Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
2. Click 'New policy' and name it (e.g., 'Require Compliant Device - All Users')
3. Under Assignments > Users: Select 'All users' (exclude emergency accounts)
4. Under Assignments > Target resources: Select 'All cloud apps'
5. Under Access controls > Grant: Select 'Require device to be marked as compliant'
6. Set 'Enable policy' to 'On' (or 'Report-only' for testing)
7. Click 'Create' to save the policy
8. Monitor via Entra ID > Sign-in logs and Conditional Access > Insights and reporting

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Conditional Access policies enforce that devices maintain baseline configuration compliance before accessing CUI and organizational resources, ensuring baseline configurations are actively maintained

settings.displayName: Security Baseline Review and Update Schedule
settings.description: Ensures security baselines are reviewed and updated on a defined schedule (recommended quarterly) and when Microsoft releases new baseline versions. Supports systematic baseline maintenance.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Establish baseline review schedule in change management process (recommend quarterly)
2. Monitor Microsoft baseline updates via Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Security baselines
3. When new versions available, review changes via 'Compare versions' option
4. Create test deployment to pilot group first
5. After validation, update production baseline profiles
6. Document review date and version in baseline profile description
7. Set calendar reminder for next review cycle (90 days)
8. Monitor compliance via Security baselines > Monitor > Profile status

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Regular baseline reviews and updates ensure baseline configurations remain current with security threats and maintain alignment with operational requirements
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]

settings.description: Continuous monitoring of device compliance with baseline configurations through Intune compliance reporting. Identifies deviations from baseline and non-compliant devices requiring remediation.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune admin center > Devices > Monitor > Compliance status
2. Review 'Compliance policy status' dashboard for baseline compliance metrics
3. Click 'Device compliance' to view detailed per-device compliance status
4. For Security Baselines: Go to Endpoint security > Security baselines > [Policy] > Monitor
5. Review 'Device status' to identify non-compliant devices
6. Set up automated email reports: Intune admin center > Reports > Export data
7. Create scheduled exports for weekly baseline compliance reports
8. Establish process to remediate non-compliant devices within defined SLA (e.g., 7 days)

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Continuous monitoring ensures baseline configurations are maintained and deviations are quickly identified and remediated, supporting configuration control requirements

settings.displayName: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint Security Baseline
settings.description: Deploys Microsoft Defender for Endpoint security baseline containing recommended configurations for attack surface reduction rules, exploit protection, network protection, and controlled folder access.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Security baselines
2. Select 'Security Baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint'
3. Click 'Create profile' and name it (e.g., 'Defender Baseline - Standard')
4. Review and configure key settings:
   - Attack surface reduction rules (enable recommended rules)
   - Network protection (enabled in block mode)
   - Controlled folder access (enabled)
   - Exploit protection (enable system-level protections)
5. Assign to device groups
6. Set to 'Enabled' and save
7. Monitor compliance via Endpoint security > Security baselines > Monitor
